snippet: The dictator of Equatorial Guinea has been accused by rights groups of embezzling hundreds of millions of dollars from his tiny, impoverished but oil-rich West African state.
abstract: Unesco, despite objections of the United States and other Western nations, will award the Unesco-Equatorial Guinea International Prize for Research in the Life Sciences financed by the dictator of Equatorial Guinea, Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, who has been accused by rights groups of embezzling hundreds of millions of dollars from his impoverished but oil-rich West-African state; US and other countries blocked the award for years because of Obiang's legal troubles, but in March, the 58-nation executive board of Unesco voted to go ahead.
lead_paragraph: The dictator of Equatorial Guinea has been accused by rights groups of embezzling hundreds of millions of dollars from his tiny, impoverished but oil-rich West African state.

headline.seo: Unesco to Give Science Prize Financed By Obiang
headline.main: Unesco to Give Science Prize Financed by Dictator
headline.print_headline: Unesco to Give Science Prize Financed By Dictator
